content:
I just noticed that Google Maps is using a star icon plus the text 'Saved'
From the concept of 'starring', 'favoring' etc. to me what is closest in meaning is actually 'Saved' messages.
@Tim Abbott what do you think?

Yeah, that could be a clearer name for some users. One thing that's interesting here is there's kinda 2 coupled use cases for starred messages:

  • Things to come back to while you're catching up
  • Things to keep track of for finding things in 3 months
    but I guess both of those make sense with the name "Saved".

I guess I'm curious for others' thoughts.
The only downside of "Saved" is that implies other messages aren't saved.
I don't think it implies that :laughing:
What would you call the un-Saved messages?

I don't think anyone thinks of the concept of server data as saved/not saved.
'Save' is used in Google Maps, 'Save for later' is used on YouTube, this does not imply the opposite for the rest of their content.
yeah, I know what you mean, but I view the Google Maps/YouTube scenarios as kind of different things
My vote here is that this is not worth changing. We'd have to change a bunch of docs, change the icon, re-translate, etc., and it's not clearly better. But others should chime in.

I do agree with Steve.
I don't know why, but I'm more comfortable calling 'starred' YouTube videos and Google Maps places 'saved' than calling 'starred' Zulip messages 'saved'. I feel like the term 'saved' can be more confusing than 'starred'.
